text.text_translated:
Gabriela was used to a 'high power distance' culture. In this culture, people respected power and leaders. Everyone had their right place. Leaders made the big decisions. People did not often disagree with leaders.

But Gabriela's team was from Sweden. They were used to a 'low power distance' culture. In this culture, workers often worked with their bosses. They found solutions and made decisions together. Leaders were like coaches. They also helped people learn. They helped workers think for themselves. They wanted workers to ask them questions. They wanted workers to tell them if they disagreed.

best_attempt.text_translated:
"Power distance" is a way to talk about how people see bosses and workers.
In a "high power distance" place, people think highly of power and authority. Everyone has their right place.
In a "low power distance" place, bosses and workers work together. They find answers and make decisions. Leaders help workers. They want workers to think for themselves and ask questions.

Gabriela worked in a job before.
Her job had a high power distance culture.
This shows that people thought highly of bosses and their power and authority.
Everyone knew their right place.
Leaders made all the big decisions.
People did not often ask them hard questions.

But Gabriela's team was from Sweden.
They worked in a low power distance culture.
This shows that workers often worked with their bosses.
They found answers to problems and made decisions together.
In Sweden, leaders were like helpers or guides.
They wanted workers to think for themselves.
They wanted workers to ask them questions.
Leaders wanted workers to ask them hard questions.
